messages.message: Do we have up-to-date docs on how to add feature flags? I always just look for all the places where existing flags are specified. It might be helpful to add something to the Control Plane docs (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CP/pages/1629650971/Configuration+Management)?

hmm — is this in reference to our environment variables? we should definitely document that more, since I don’t think we have a clear reference on it at all. but as a general rule, the places a flag needs to be added depends on the code paths that reference it and which services that code lives in.
i was referring to the variables in `shared-utils/build-utils/shared/env-local.json` since i needed to add a new flag (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/24760)
+1, where the flag is used will determine what services it needs to be added to

oh yeah — so that’s kind of just a hack for when too many services reference the same environment variable. The json way of configuring values is deprecated with control plane now, which would use patches as overrides instead. Let me add a doc to call some of these points out!
